III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/01/24, staff member slammed a youth. The staff member
tackled the youth like a football player because the youth was
about to fight another youth. The staff member was injured. The
youth hit their head on the ground. The staff member was lying on
top of the youth's stomach while they were on the ground for 5
minutes. Youth did not have visible injuries.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed via telephone on October 7, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker and Officer who were at the
facility. Youth A described recently getting into a fight with Youth
B outside by unit 3. Youth A stated she was walking back to her
unit from class. Youth A reported there were staff with her, but
she could not recall which staff. Youth A stated Staff 1 stopped
Youth A from fighting by “jumping on me and pinning me down
because I was going to jump Youth B.” Youth A reported being
knocked off her feet and landing on the cement. Youth A stated
her right arm hit the cement but did not have marks or bruises
from the fall. Youth A denied her arm hurt or any other part of her
body. Youth A reported she did not hit her head. Youth A stated
Staff 1 “kinda grabbed” her and they both fell together to the
ground from Staff 1’s momentum. Youth A reported Staff 1
“seemed to slip or trip on my foot causing the fall.” Youth A
2

stated all of the youth were outside because they were headed
back to the unit from school. Youth A reported feeling safe at the
facility and not being afraid of anyone.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on October 7, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker and Officer who were at the
facility. Staff 1 stated school was just getting done and Youth A
and Youth B were trying to get into a fight. Staff 1 reported there
were multiple staff and youth outside in the walkway/corridor.
Staff 1 described Youth A ripping her shirt off and taking off after
Youth B. Staff 1 stated Youth A was “booking and running really
fast” so Staff 1 tried to run to get to Youth A. Staff 1 reported she
fell or tripped, she was not sure which, and collided into Youth A
falling on top of Youth A who landed on her back. Staff 1 stated
Youth A and Staff 1 fell onto the cement. Staff 1 reported getting
“pretty banged up” and showed bruises, marks, scraps on her
ankle and leg, (DHHS Worker took pictures and sent to me). Staff
1 described moving to the side of Youth A and Youth A getting up.
Staff 1 reported she was on top of Youth A for approximately five
seconds. Staff 1 stated Supervisor had to help her up. Staff 1
denied Youth A having any marks or bruised. Staff 1 reported
Youth A said she was fine and not injured. Staff 1 denied seeing
Youth A hit her head. Staff 1 stated Youth A was running fast,
and Staff 1 was trying to get to Youth A before she started fighting
with Youth B. Staff 1 denied tackling Youth A. Staff 1 stated, “it
might have looked like that but not my intent. I’m heavy if I did this
to myself (bruises on leg/ankle) imagine what I could do to a kid.”
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 8, 2024. Supervisor described Youth A and Youth B
trying to fight outside unit 3 right after school was dismissed.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 was trying to get to Youth A when
Staff 1 and Youth A collided causing both to fall to the ground.
Supervisor stated Youth A immediately stood up and continued to
go after Youth B. Supervisor reported he had to help Staff 1 get to
her feet as Staff 1 was injured in the fall. Supervisor stated he
believes Staff 1 might have landed on Youth A’s lower leg in the
fall but was not completely certain. Supervisor reported he was
not aware of Youth A having any marks or bruises. Supervisor
denied Youth A saying she was hurt or injured in the fall.
Supervisor stated he does not believe Staff 1 was trying to collide
into Youth A and fall to the ground, rather Staff 1 was trying to
manage the environment and keep Youth A from getting to Youth
B.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
8, 2024. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B exchanged some
verbal comments after school that led to the two trying to fight one
another on their way back to the units. Staff 2 stated Youth A ran
from staff (could not recall who) and Staff 1 ran towards Youth A
to stop Youth A from reaching Youth B. Staff 2 described Staff 1
trying to “grab” Youth A but tripping or falling, Staff 2 was not sure
which, and falling into Youth A causing Staff 1 and Youth A to fall
to the ground. Staff 2 denied being aware of Youth A getting
injured or having any marks or bruises. Staff 2 stated Youth A did
not appear to be injured as Youth A got right back up after falling
to go after Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 1’s pantleg had a hole
in it, and Staff 1’s knee and ankle were bruised from the fall. Staff
2 denied seeing Staff 1 tackle Youth A. Staff 2 stated it was more
like Staff 1 fell into Youth A. Staff 2 could not recall if Staff 1
landed on Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
October 8, 2024. Youth C described getting out of school and
walking back to the units when Youth A and Youth B tried to fight
one another. Youth C stated staff were trying to keep Youth A and
Youth B away from one another. Youth C reported there were a
lot of staff because it was shift change but could not recall the
names of all the staff involved. Youth C stated “Staff 1 tackled
Youth A like a football player” causing both to fall to the ground.
Youth C described Staff 1 and Youth A being on the ground for
about one minute before Youth A got up. Youth C stated Youth A
landed on her back and hit her head. Youth C reported Staff 1’s
pants got ripped and Staff 1 got hurt “really bad.” Youth C stated
she was on a 1:1 with Staff 2 so they left to get ice for Staff 1, so
Youth C did not see anything else that occurred.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
8, 2024. Staff 3 stated she was in the breakroom, heard
commotion coming from outside so went outside to see what was
happening. Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth B were yelling at
one another and Youth A was trying to get to Youth B. Staff 3
stated she along with Staff 5 placed Youth A in a restraint to keep
Youth A from getting to Youth B. Staff 3 denied seeing anything
between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 3 reported the incident
between Staff 1 and Youth A occurred right before Staff 3 came
outside. Staff 3 stated Youth A did not have any marks/bruises or
say anything hurt to Staff 3. Staff 3 reported she was aware Staff
1 was injured from falling but denied seeing Staff 1 fall.
4

Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on October
8, 2024. Staff 4 described the incident between Youth A and
Youth B occurring toward shift change when moving the group
from school to the units. Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth B
had been fine, getting along all day at school until after school
when they began to argue. Staff 4 stated a couple of staff (could
not recall who) were talking with Youth A as she was very
escalated and wanted to fight Youth B. Staff 4 reported her back
was turned to Youth A because Staff 4 was facing Youth B trying
to keep her separated from Youth A. Staff 4 described hearing a
“loud boom” and turned to see Staff 1 on the ground. Staff 4
denied seeing Youth A on the ground. Staff 4 reported things
were happening quickly. Staff 4 stated Youth A was placed in a
standing restraint by Staff 3 and Staff 5. Staff 4 reported the
restraint was after Staff 4 saw Staff 1 on the ground. Staff 4
denied being aware of Youth A having any marks/bruises or
injuries. Staff 4 denied seeing Staff 1 tackle Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at
the facility. Youth B described Youth A running after Youth B to
try and fight and Staff 1 tried to run after Youth A to stop Youth A
but tripped on the pole outside and fell. Youth B stated Staff 1 got
hurt from the fall, but Youth A did not get hurt. Youth B reported
Youth A got right back up and wanted to fight. Youth B denied
Staff 1 tackling Youth A. Youth B stated Staff 1 did what she was
supposed to do trying to stop Youth A from getting to Youth B.
Youth B reported Youth A never got to her because Youth A
ended up getting restrained. Youth B stated she could not recall
what staff placed Youth A in a restraint. Youth B denied ever
seeing Staff 1 tackle any youth. Youth B described Staff 1 as
nice, firm with the rules, and holds youth accountable.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at
the facility. Youth D stated she could not recall any time Youth A
and Youth B tried to fight one another. Youth D stated she knew
of one time Staff 1 tried to break up youth from fighting outside
and tripped and fell. Youth D reported she could not recall what
youth Staff 1 was trying to keep from fighting. Youth D stated
Staff 1 always breaks up fights. Youth D denied seeing Staff 1
ever tackle, push, or hurt any youth. Youth D described Staff 1 as
being good at her job, kind, and funny.
Youth E was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at
5

the facility. Youth E reported Staff 1 tried to stop Youth A and
Youth B from fighting outside. Youth E said Staff 1 basically
grabbed Youth A and tackled her to the ground. Youth E reported
Staff 1 was speed walking to get to Youth A, reached Youth A and
“bear hugged” Youth A from the side and took Youth A to the
ground. Youth E stated she felt Staff 1 was trying to prevent a
fight from happening and did not tackle Youth A on purpose.
Youth E reported Staff 1 got injured but Youth A did not get hurt.
Youth E stated she did not recall seeing Youth A hit her head on
the ground. Youth E described Youth A getting right back up after
landing on the ground to try and fight Youth B. Youth E denied
seeing Staff 1 ever tackle, push, or slam a youth to the ground.
Youth E described Staff 1 as an okay staff, encouraging everyone,
always there for us (youth) even though we don’t want her to be
sometimes, and someone Youth E appreciates.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on October 23, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was face to face at
the facility. Youth F described Staff 1 tackling Youth A like a
“NFL tackle,” and taking Youth A to the ground. Youth F stated
Youth A hit her head, could not recall what part of her head, and
remained on the ground for 2-3 minutes with Staff 1 laying on top
of Youth A. Youth F reported she did not believe Youth A was
hurt anywhere else. Youth F denied ever seeing Staff 1 tackle a
youth in the past. Youth F reported Staff 1 tackled Youth A
because she did not want a Child Protective case for allowing
youth to fight.
Video review:
There is no camera outside unit 3 door that would show the
incident with Staff 1 and Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff Safety Plan dated 10/3/2024 for Staff 1. Plan outlines
Staff 1 not being alone with any youth and not engaging in
any physical restraints unless she is the only staff available
for the restraint.
• Staff 1’s personal file. Staff 1 had one employee
counseling form dated 10/22/21 unrelated to this type of
incident. Staff 1 completed the CPI training on 05/14/2024.
• Covenant Health Care report for Youth A dated 10/03/24.
Report indicates, “[Youth A] got in a physical fight with one
of the other residents there. Staff quickly broke up the fight
and the patient says she really does not have any injuries.
6

Physical exam is benign. At this point I feel the patient is
stable to be discharged back to the facility.”
• Policy and Procedure for CPI. Policy documents the focus
is to provide immediate emotional and environmental
support to clients in crisis so that stress and the risk for
violence are reduced.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as during interviews with Staff
1, Staff 2, Supervisor, Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D, Staff 1 and
Youth A fell to the ground when Staff 1 attempted to prevent
Youth A from fighting Youth B. Youth C, Youth E, and Youth F all
reported Staff 1 tackled Youth A, however in interviews the
description of Staff 1 falling/tripping could have been perceived as
Staff 1 tackling the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
